answers.answer: For me, I only did one my first pregnancy. I'm in baby #6 and a different dr and haven't done any since my first. I'm not sure why not.

I did a non stress test with my daughter (I didn't think they gave women stress tests!)The non stress test is basically fetal monitoring. They have you lay down in a semi reclined position and sick all the monitors on like they will in the hospital when you're in labor. They monitor contractions (strength and timing) and baby's heartbeat. You can also hear baby moving around! My little girl got the hiccups during mine so her heart rate read kinda funky!They did a non stress test for us because my water had been broken for a couple of days and they wanted to check my baby. She was fine, but my fluid was so low I ended up going in to be induced that night so that she remained fine! She was born a little less than twenty hours after my non stress test!
Nope i havent and im on my third child

I just has mine today and I'm 40+4, they did a non stress test on me because I'm past my due date and they are already planned for me to be induced Thursday. It only took maybe 30 minutes, I got an ultrasound to check the amniotic fluid levels before the they put me on a fetal monitor then they waited till he moved ten times.

not every pregnant women does a stress test. its only for who has complications such as seizures, diabetes, high blood pressure etc. things like that.  I have them for seizures.your just getting monitor.u get ultra soundthey look at ur baby heart rate, see if ur contracting and ur amnotic fluids. things like that
I forgot they monitor baby's movement! Yeah they gave me a button to press each time she moved for half an hour or an hour... can't remember!
and its usually when ur like 36 weeks u start them
I had mine in my first pregnancy. They just looked at your baby movement and heartbeat. I'm expecting now dont know if they going to do the same for this one.

question: Do every pregnant person do a stress test? How many weeks you have to be when you get it ? And what do they do?
title: stress test
